pages.text: Just like $(l:aoa3:shotguns#shotguns)shotguns$(/l), $(thing)snipers$() are a sub-class of $(l:aoa3:guns#guns)guns$(/l), and work in a similar mannager.$(br2)Where $(thing)shotguns$() focus on short-range fire, $(thing)snipers$() excel at long-range. No $(thing)gun$() or $(l:aoa3:bows#bows)bow$(/l) can compete with a $(thing)sniper$() at range.
pages.title: Snipers

pages.text: While similar, $(thing)snipers$() do have a very important functional distinction from $(l:aoa3:guns#guns)guns$(/l).$(br)To properly fire a $(thing)sniper$(), you must crouch, which will scope in and give you a better long-distance view. Failing to scope in will cause shots to be wildly inaccurate, so it's recommended to scope in for every shot.$(br2)$(thing)Sniper$() shots travel incredibly quickly, and will strike the target far quicker than any other ranged weapon.
Take out long range targets before they even know what hit them with a $(thing)sniper$()!
pages.title: A Sniper

pages.text: Find info on all of the $(thing)snipers$() in $(aoa) on the $(thing)official wiki$().
